main event: A group of people witnessed three large, bright, disk-shaped objects flying in the night sky, leaving behind sparkling streams before disappearing.
interesting points: The witnesses estimated the objects to be at least 200 feet in diameter and between 15,000 to 20,000 feet above normal flying altitude.
The objects emitted a blue neon glow and appeared to have a tumbling, edgy movement before disappearing into the midnight blue sky.
The witnesses initially speculated that the objects were part of a hush-hush military exercise, but later became convinced of their existence due to multiple reports and their own observations.
The report mentions other testimonies and evidence of similar sightings, implying a pattern of unexplained aerial phenomena.
The writer expresses conviction about the existence of these 'flying saucers' and hints at the existence of classified information known to some individuals but kept hidden from public knowledge.
witnesses: multiple witnesses including a high ranking Navy member
